com.marcosgarciacasado.pem

Class ObservableProcess

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • com.marcosgarciacasado.pem.ObservableProcess
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Observer

    public class ObservableProcess
extends java.util.Observable
implements java.util.Observer
    Manages the execution of a process through command line and reads its standard output stream to launch events when it matches with an specific regular expression.
    See Also:
    Observable, Observer, ProcessEvent, ProcessStatus
     

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private ProcessStatus actualStatus
      Represents the status of the process at the moment of the observation.
      private java.lang.String cmd
      Contains the command associated with the process.
      private java.util.ArrayList<ProcessEvent> eventList
      Contains a list of events that can be launched during the execution of the process whether a line returned by the standard output matches a specific regular expression which activates it.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      private ObservableProcess()
      Basic constructor.
        ObservableProcess(java.lang.String cmd)
      Constructor of the process defined by the command passed by argument.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addEvent(ProcessEvent e)
      Adds a new event to the process that could be activated during the process execution.
      private void eventMatchesLine(java.lang.String line)
      Passes the line given by argument through every event registered in the process so that it activates when the line matches it's regular expression.
      ProcessStatus getActualStatus()
      Obtains the current status of the process.
      java.lang.String getCmd()
      Obtains the command associated to the process.
      void removeEvent(ProcessEvent e)
      If it has been inserted before, removes the event passed by argument from the list of events that the process manages.
      void resetStatus()
      Establishes the status of the process to an Initial Status.
      void runProcess()
      Launches the process and analyzes line by line its output to check the events.
      void setActualStatus(ProcessStatus actualStatus)
      Sets the current status of the process to the one given by argument.
      void setCmd(java.lang.String cmd)
      Changes the command associated to the process with the one given through the argument.

    • Field Detail

      • cmd

        private java.lang.String cmd
        Contains the command associated with the process. When the process is run, this command is launched to the System.

      • actualStatus

        private ProcessStatus actualStatus
        Represents the status of the process at the moment of the observation.

      • eventList

        private java.util.ArrayList<ProcessEvent> eventList
        Contains a list of events that can be launched during the execution of the process whether a line returned by the standard output matches a specific regular expression which activates it.
        See Also:
        ProcessEvent

    • Constructor Detail

      • ObservableProcess

        private ObservableProcess()
        Basic constructor. It is set to private method to force user to insert arguments using the rest of the constructors.

      • ObservableProcess

        public ObservableProcess(java.lang.String cmd)
        Constructor of the process defined by the command passed by argument.
        Parameters:
        cmd - Command associated to the process.

    • Method Detail

      • getCmd

        public java.lang.String getCmd()
        Obtains the command associated to the process.
        Returns:
        The command associated to the process.

      • setCmd

        public void setCmd(java.lang.String cmd)
        Changes the command associated to the process with the one given through the argument.
        Parameters:
        cmd - New command associated to the process.

      • addEvent

        public void addEvent(ProcessEvent e)
        Adds a new event to the process that could be activated during the process execution.
        Parameters:
        e - The event to be added.
        See Also:
        ProcessEvent

      • removeEvent

        public void removeEvent(ProcessEvent e)
        If it has been inserted before, removes the event passed by argument from the list of events that the process manages.
        Parameters:
        e - The event to be removed
        See Also:
        ProcessEvent

      • getActualStatus

        public ProcessStatus getActualStatus()
        Obtains the current status of the process.
        Returns:
        the actualStatus

      • setActualStatus

        public void setActualStatus(ProcessStatus actualStatus)
        Sets the current status of the process to the one given by argument.
        Parameters:
        actualStatus - The new status of the process.

      • resetStatus

        public void resetStatus()
        Establishes the status of the process to an Initial Status.

      • update

        public void update(java.util.Observable arg0,
          java.lang.Object arg1)
        Specified by:
        update in interface java.util.Observer

      • runProcess

        public void runProcess()
        Launches the process and analyzes line by line its output to check the events.

      • eventMatchesLine

        private void eventMatchesLine(java.lang.String line)
        Passes the line given by argument through every event registered in the process so that it activates when the line matches it's regular expression.
        Parameters:
        line - Line to be checked.
